column4: I don't think I'll ever understand exactly how bash handles whitespace and why. As long as you don't have to work with anything containing any special characters, ever, bash is great.
I write a blender farm with bash.
It was awesome. Combined multiple OS's and everything.
That's hell when you're trying to work with anything you didn't name yourself. Like wine directory names.
radar: if the ubuntu one doesn't work, feel free to use http://pastebin.ca/
powerbook is the G4 line,  macbook is the intel macs
run Mac + OSX + Windows all on the same machine
